num_tested_probands: The case report describes a single proband (31-year-old man) with WARS2-related mitochondrial disease.
The report focuses on a 31-year-old patient with a hyperkinetic movement disorder.
num_positive_het_probands: There are no single heterozygous carriers described in the proband. The focus is on biallelic variants.
There is no mention of heterozygous carriers of pathogenic variants.
positive_phenotypes: The proband presented with severe hyperkinetic movement disorder, dystonia, chorea, ballism, cognitive deficits, and developmental delay as described throughout the case report.
The clinical presentation for the patient includes severe hyperkinetic movement disorder, uncontrollable dystonic and ballistic movements, and the ability to communicate nonverbally.
num_compound_or_double_hets: The proband is a compound heterozygote, as indicated by the presence of two variants in WARS2: a paternally inherited and a maternally inherited variant.
The mention of 'biallelic variants in WARS2 encoding' from the references implies compound heterozygous mutations in affected individuals.
